column1: Although the problem usually goes away over time, many children, and even a small number of adults, continue to have bedwetting episodes.
Remember that your child has no control over bedwetting.
Contact your child's doctor right away if your child is having pain with urination, fever, or blood in the urine.
Your child's doctor may prescribe a medication called DDAVP (desmopressin) to treat bedwetting.
